title: Lecture: Who Builds Your Architecture?
short_description: Members of the coalition Who Builds Your Architecture?, including co-founders Kadambari Baxi and Mabel Wilson, explore questions about networks of labor in architectural projects ar …
list_description: Members of the coalition Who Builds Your Architecture?, including co-founders Kadambari Baxi and Mabel Wilson, explore questions about networks of labor in architectural projects ar …
description:
Who Builds Your Architecture (WBYA?) is a coalition of architects, activists, scholars, and educators that addresses pressing questions about international networks of labor in architectural projects around the world. Members of WBYA?, including project co-founders Kadambari Baxi and Mabel Wilson, explore this timely subject in an illuminating presentation.

Kadambari Baxi, Barnard College
Jordan Carver, PhD candidate, New York University
Laura Diamond Dixit, PhD candidate, Columbia GSAPP
Tiffany Rattray, Studio Tack
Lindsey Wikstrom, Studio Gang
Mabel O. Wilson, Columbia GSAPP

Presented in conjunction with the exhibition Who Builds Your Architecture?, on view through June 11.
